ref: Jour: Arkiv foer Fysik, Vol.29, p.45 (1965)
title: A method for the absolute measurement of fast neutron flux with a large liquid scintillator

x4codes.hlp: Research Inst. for National Defence, Stockholm, Sweden

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Arkiv foer Fysik, Vol.29, p.45 (1965)

x4freetext: A method for the absolute measurement of fast neutron
flux with a large liquid scintillator

x4codes.hlp: Research Inst. for National Defence, Stockholm, Sweden

x4freetext: Van de Graaff generator
Pulsed neutron beam, Li7(p,n)Be7 reaction,
Li-metal target
.The neutrons from the source were collimated by a
channel, 40 cm long, through a block of paraffin.
.Li-6 glass containing 5.07 +- 0.08% by weight. The
isotopic enrichment was 95.17 +- 0.02% in Li-6.
Its dimensions were 1.5 inch diameter, and 3/8 inch
thickness. At the same time detector.
.A Li6-loaded glass scintillator was mounted
in the centre of a liquid scintillator tank and the
number of (n,alpha) reactions in the glass was re-
gistered for a certain integrated neutron flux
which was given by the scintillator tank.
The efficiency of the scintillator tank for an
isotropic neutron flux was well known. For the
collimated beam used here, a lead scatterer was placed
in the beam, which acts as a pure isotropic scatterer.
(TRN) The fraction of neutrons scattered was
determined by a transmission measurement (the total
cross section is equal to the scattering cross sect.)
in this way the incoming neutron flux can be
absolutely measured.
Time-of-flight techniques have been used to
select the primary neutrons and discriminate against
neutrons scattered in the glass, thermalized in the
tank and scattered back in the glass-detector.
Li6-loaded glass scintillator
Liquid scintillator tank for neutron flux
measurement by looking at the fraction of the
collimated neutron beam which was scattered by means
of a lead scatterer mounted at the center of the tank
just in front of the glass detector.
.The flux is monitored by a current integrator on the
lithium metal target and by a Li6-I(Eu) scintillator
in a polyethylene sphere.
.Value somewhat lower than the value published in
.Good agreement with the relative measurement of
Schwarz et al, Nucl.Phys.63(1965)593.(See entry 20059)

flag.hlp: Reference to related data compiled in another entry

x4freetext: .Scattering in the scintillator liquid of neutrons
scattered out of the beam increase the number of
neutrons detected by the Li6-glass.  The use of time-
of-flight techniques keeps this correction below 0.5%.
.Correction for multiple scattering in the glass
detector using a Monte-Carlo technique, 7%.
